qas.question: What kind of  shifts are taking place in Catalan speaking areas?
How old are most of the native language speakers in northern Catalonia?
When was it determined that most native speakers in France are 60 or older?
What percentage of primary students study Catalan as a foreign language?
What do 15% of secondary school students study as a foreign language?

context: On the other hand, there are several <a0_0>language shift processes<a0_0/> currently taking place. In Northern Catalonia, <a4_0>Catalan<a4_0/> has followed the same trend as the other minority languages of France, with most of its native speakers being <a1_0>60 or older<a1_0/> (as of <a2_0>2004<a2_0/>). Catalan is studied as a foreign language by <a3_0>30%<a3_0/> of the primary education students, and by 15% of the secondary. The cultural association La Bressola promotes a network of community-run schools engaged in Catalan language immersion programs.
